getTables

public Set<Integer> getTables()
Gets a Set of ids for all tables in the tournament. Note 1: If tables are added or removed, the set will be updated asynchronously, so there is no guarantee that newly created or removed tables are present or non present in this Set. Note 2: Game developers should NOT modify the returned Set. This will lead to unpredictable behavior. Use MTTSupport.#createTables(MTTStateSupport, int, String) and MTTSupport.#closeTable(MTTStateSupport, Integer).

Returns:
a Set of ids for all tables in the tournament.

public void tablesCreated()
Called by Firebase when tables have been created.

getRegisteredPlayersCount

public int getRegisteredPlayersCount()
Description copied from interface: MTTState

Gets number of players that is/was registered. This will be used as a registered counter when in register state and as a comparison in the lobby when in running state.

Example:

REGISTERING: Tourn-1 27/100 Open
Tournament is open and 27 players have registered. There is still room for 73 more.

REGISTERING: Tourn-1 45/85 Running
Tournament got 85 participants and is now running. There are currently 45 players left (40 players are out).

Specified by:
getRegisteredPlayersCount in interface MTTState
Returns:
player count
